intro: Stiza erioloba, commonly known as the Natal wild bean, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in grasslands and woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are trifoliate, and it produces small, yellowish-white flowers that attract pollinators. Stiza erioloba is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
